title: Grosvernor Hotel Typeface - Please help ID
content:
Hi All,  
Can someone please help ID this typeface for me?  
(Horrendous truck-smash tracking)

Cheers!  
P.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [grosvenor.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143834/http:/typophile.com/files/grosvenor.jpg) | 49.43 KB |

 [‹ (x) G in Gorgeous - Exelsior Script, Agenda {Skylar Fein, Patricia, Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143834/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29158 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Specials" wide connected retro script at Font Diner - Permanent Waves {Patricia, Marc O} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143834/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29161 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pbags

comments.content:
Hoo boy. That really is something! Do you know for a fact that this is a typeface? The geometry of it suggests to me that it might have been hand drawn.

Skylar

It sure is something... It’s a sponsor logo for a document we’re putting together - and that’s all the new owners of the establishment have.. I would have first guessed some free font from the murky depths of the internet... but to answer your question, no I don’t know that it actually is a typeface, but given the ’clip art’ nature of the background, I assumed it was a very hasty design job with no budget for custom work (even bad custom work...)

Cheers/
